title: Suburban Omaha ex-maintenance man accused of sex assaults
title_page: Suburban Omaha ex-maintenance man accused of sex assaults
maintext:
PAPILLION, Neb. (AP) — Deputies in suburban Omaha have arrested a former apartment maintenance worker suspected of sexually assaulting at least four women.
Hector Guardado-Alfaro, 42, of Omaha, was arrested Thursday on warrants charging him with first-degree sexual assault, the Sarpy County Sheriff’s Office said in a news release. Officials said the arrest came after multiple woman reported being assaulted by Guardado-Alfaro.
Investigators believe Guardado-Alfaro used his former position as a maintenance worker to attack at least four women. Investigators said in court documents that the victims were both co-workers and residents of the apartment complex. Officials are asking any others who believe their were assaulted by Guardado-Alfaro to contact the sheriff’s office.
No attorney was listed for Guardado-Alfaro in online court documents.
